meanings.definition: Lesser in size, extent, or importance
meanings.sent1: The toy car was minor compared to the real car.
meanings.sent2: The small rock was a minor obstacle in our path.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ant had a minor role in the insect kingdom.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was so soft, it seemed minor in the noisy room.
meanings.sent5: The little seed grew into a minor plant in the garden.

meanings.sent1: As a minor, she couldn't watch the movie without an adult.
meanings.sent2: The teenager was considered a minor in the eyes of the law.
meanings.sent3: The young boy tried to act mature, but his minor status gave him away.
meanings.sent4: Being a minor meant she couldn't sign the contract on her own.
meanings.sent5: The minor student needed parental permission to go on the field trip.

meanings.sent1: The store refused to sell the game to the minor without ID.
meanings.sent2: The minor was accompanied by a guardian to the event.
meanings.sent3: The minor was excited to finally be old enough to drive.
meanings.sent4: The minor's parents had to sign the school form for permission.
meanings.sent5: The minor was not allowed to enter the club without an adult.
